reviewText: I love billy blanks and I've used most of his older dvds.  I was looking for the next step up and this was it!  It's hardcore!  You barely stop moving and it's an awesome workout!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have been working out to Tae Bo for years. My first was a VHS and I always considered the VHS workouts to be much more advanced and difficult than the new up-to-date DVD's. I will admit that the older version of TaeBo, although a great workout, was a bit boring. The outfits! lol I won't even go into the music. Something you would hear in a hospital elevator. This TaeBo Classic DVD was not boring at all. It goes back to many of the kicks you would see in the older VHS workouts. Of course he had to put some squats in it. I am sure I will barely be able to walk in the morning;)At this moment my legs feel like jelly.It actually does my heart good to see all the participants sweat, and holler and grunt as they work out. It shows that even the thin and fit struggled with this workout. It took me 2 times to finally be able to finish the hour long DVD.I do believe that the Amped! series will always be my favorite maybe because it isn't as intense or as long as the Classic DVD and I will admit I hate doing kicks and squats but my legs and butt are proof that I hate such exercises. So I will definitely continue to put this in my routine at least once a week to help my legs and butt and continue to help with my weight loss as I am sure TaeBo Classic burns many more calories than the Amped!The only negative would be he doesn't always do the same exercise on one side as he does on the other. That could just be my mild OCD kicking it ;) And on one particular part when they go into cardio they do the same side they just finished. And there's the usual lie Billy loves to tell "okay, guys one more set" ;)I wouldn't recommend TaeBo Classic to a beginner but advanced TaeBo followers should be prepared to call Billy names by the end of it;)
summary: Pouring Sweat in an Air Conditioned House!

reviewText: What happened to the original Tae Bo videos? I thought this would be the closest thing to the awesome workout that was on the original advanced series. Instead what you get is Billy Blanks having a nostalgia party while giving you a really mediocre workout. It should be a drinking game. Every time you hear Billy say "original" you take a drink.Please release the "real original" series to DVD.  Nothing as good has been released since.
Title: N/A

reviewText: First things first - this is not a newly filmed version of the beloved VHS Tae Bo Advanced.  That class was 55 minutes with 33 minutes of cardio, the LEGENDARY 11 minute floor leg routine, 5 minutes of abs and then he stretches you out.  Yes this does have many but not all of those standing moves - no neck rolls - but it is not the same routine.  But the class does have an old school Tae Bo feel similar to the Ripped and the Live classes circa early 2000.  (Note: if you really are nostalgic for the first advanced set you can find it for download on internet. )The production is much better than the old days and it is filmed on the Dojo set with the smaller class of seven people.  This is a pure cardio class that is 63 minutes with all standing work. It starts with a cardio warm-up and then moves into stretches.  The official class starts around five minutes in with jabs and continues until 57 minute mark when the cool down starts.  The last 10 minutes of the cardio focuses on the "buttocks" according to Billy but I felt it in my quads and hamstrings.This is not a beginner class due to the length (52 minutes of pure cardio) but I think a beginner could do it with breaks and modification of not going so deep in the legs.  Also, Tae Bo really does not have choreography but instead uses combinations which Billy breaks down a couple of times slow and then has you do them at tempo.  Although the combinations may take a few reps to get down so you are moving with the group this routine is doable for people who are dance or choreography challenged especially since Shelly and the group call out the counts and the moves of the combinations.I will update after doing the workout wearing my hear rate monitor but I would queses the calorie burn to be around 750 - 1000 depending on your age and weight.

reviewText: I am an old tae bo fan from the early 90's.  Those tapes kept me fit.  When I noticed this "Classic" DVD, I had to order it.  Excellent workout.  I worked out for an hour, but it only seemed like a few minutes.  Fun workout, made me sweat and feel good.  Buy this, you will love it.
summary: Absolutely love this workout, you will too!
